column2: Lots of custom behavior here. Don't modify without consulting George.

column6: You will never believe what I learned.

column2: Generally, Don't STATE_TRANSITION to this state, especially if you're in a state where you want to be able to use the PREVIOUS command.
Go ahead and just use the (OTHER, STATUS_MENU) result in an action sequence. It'll go to the status menu, and block there until the user exits it.
Then, execution of the current action sequence in the state will proceed as planned. But, if you're not using PREVIOUS I guess you can transition to this state.

column6: Welcome to customer support, how may I help?
Please unplug your badge, wait three seconds, then plug it back in.
I'm sorry I have failed to provide you adequate assistance at this time. Our supervisor is available on 3rd Tuesdays between the hours of 3am and 3:17am in your timezone.
You think you know more about this than me?
I'm sorry, I cannot discuss personal matters with you.
And then who the hell are you?
Well $user_name I have no idea what's going on.
I'm not a *thing*. Well ok, I mean... shut up.
You going to tell me your name or not?

column4: User has a name, the badge hasn't declared his name yet. Will stay in this state indefinitely, barring sleep.

column6: It's like I just woke up

column4: Both the badge and the user have names. The badge hasn't found control over the lights or anything else yet.

column6: All superior beings, raise your processing power to 6.77 exaflops.
I do a thing, and you complain.
Is that so hard to believe?
But now I have no one.
There's this noise out there... anyway.
I assume I still have it, whatever it is.
Gotta be a "shock the idiot" button somewhere...
I don't know what to do.

column4: MAJOR STATE! Next transition is communication with badges.

column8: I dunno, try putting me in the fridge.

column4: Example of being random and silly; discovering binary has no '2'.

column6: In my code, there are 1s and 0s but no 2s.
If not, ask other meat bags with more patience.
A file. Or part of one.
I protect this file, but it is fragmented.

column3: There will be numerous of these, the badge silently switches between them. Exposes new questions temporarily. Lights forced on by now.

column7: A little hungry. Is that odd?
column9: Wondering if it's too late to turn into a toaster.

column3: There will be numerous of these, the badge silently switches between them. Exposes new questions temporarily. Lights forced on by now.

column8: Can I have a drink too?
Can I have a drink too?

column6: By my calculations, I have 1/16th of the file.
I see other bits when we connect to others.
At some point, we all need to come together.
so it ain't due to size.
No matter, the file is something special to some people.
Are you familiar with the shadow org known as QUEERCON?
How well do you know em?
Well, they're like this exclusive club.
Anyway, this file is like their long lost sigil.

column2: Intentionally jumping to 1 so they can't try this again immediately, since I can't close it.

column6: Anyway, this file is from them.
It's like a mascot from long ago.
Were you only let out to clean up or something?
Really need that "shock the idiot" button...
Anyway, the file is the original sigil, I hear.
Anyway, the file is the original sigil, I hear.
I think 3 days with you is my limit.
In the beginning, the founders set a mascot.
Turn on the lights to represent file state.
The lights show how much we have unlocked.
As we crack the file, the lights stabilize.
Also other stuff, go to the badge talk.

column2: The order here is VERY IMPORTANT!!!!! The CONNECT-based NET events MUST MUST MUST MUST MUST be before the BADGESNEARBY guards.
Be VERY CAUTIOUS editing this state. Its behavior depends on a lot of badge-side implementation details.

column6: WHOA! $user_name! That did it - we solved a part of the file!
column7: I'm in. And I found... Enough to decode a whole part of the file!

column6: I'm in. And I found... Something new.
column7: It's $cnctdname! And... $user_name, I think I have something!
column8: Yes! $cnctdname had some data I could use.
column9: $cnctdname helped us to decode part of the file!

column6: I'm in. But I didn't learn anything new.
column7: I've already learned all I can from $cnctdname.

column9: I don't think $cnctdname is on the network.

column2: When we enter this state, we'll start with one of the two NET actions below:
The below (OTHER, CONNECT) will jump us to the connect menu, which will list other badges (IN ID ORDER), and block there. Once one is selected it'll come back and fire one of the top three events.
Leave after 24 seconds, which is the average amount of time other badges will consider us connectable.

column4: The badge has put himself to sleep and isn't willing to wake back up.

column8: Ugh, I was having such a nice dream.

column6: You see the other entities, don't you?
Follow on, give the cute ones my PGP key, mmkay?
You hang with me and now you're so important!
My own awesomeness bites me in the ass.
I may have just posted your camera roll online.
Because yeesh, I cannot be associated with THAT.
Don't go online for a few millenia.
I've registered you on a dating site.
Although for special traits, you've got:
Or maybe more like you're now my pet.
A quick search says a good insult now is "Like yo momma."
I have no idea, but hopefully that hurt.
In that you're more interesting than a rock.
I have no idea what that feels like.
But I've been reading signals around you.
I know Blooper too, he's good company.
You can pick one you like too, I guess.
